reasons_to_visit.details: March signals the start of spring in Coimbra. Witness the Botanical Garden and Quinta das Lágrimas begin to bloom, offering pleasant walks as days get warmer (avg. 17-18°C high).
Enjoy Coimbra's main attractions like the University library and museums with fewer tourists than peak summer or spring festival times. Accommodation prices are generally moderate.
Experience the lively buzz of the University city with students back in full swing after winter break, filling cafes and streets, especially during weekdays.
The milder temperatures are ideal for exploring Coimbra's hilly terrain, wandering through the Alta and Baixa districts without the intense summer heat.
If Easter falls in late March, you might witness local religious processions or traditions associated with Semana Santa (Holy Week).

reasons_to_visit.reason: Good Base for Exploring Central Portugal
reasons_to_visit.details: Use Coimbra as a base to visit nearby historical sites like Conímbriga Roman ruins or the Batalha Monastery as the weather improves for day trips.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March weather can be highly variable. Expect a mix of sunny days, but also potential for significant rain showers and cooler, windy periods. Pack for all conditions.
Evenings and nights remain quite cool (avg. low 7-8°C), requiring warm jackets or sweaters.

reasons_to_reconsider.reason: Gardens Not Yet at Peak Bloom
reasons_to_reconsider.details: While starting to awaken, the gardens won't be as lush or colorful as later in spring (April/May).
If Easter falls in March, expect a surge in visitors (especially domestic/Spanish tourists), higher accommodation prices, and busier attractions.
Following winter rains, some older buildings or less sunny spots can still feel damp, even if daytime temperatures are mild.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of rain continues from winter (around 90-100mm over 9-11 days), but increasing chance of sunny spells.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, sweaters, a waterproof jacket. Comfortable, possibly waterproof, walking shoes essential for hills and potential rain. Umbrella useful.

tourism_level.crowds: Low to Moderate. Quieter period before spring season fully kicks in.
tourism_level.pricing: Good shoulder season value generally available.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: City feels academic and local. Pleasant for exploring on clearer days, quiet evenings.

events_holidays.name: University Life in Session
events_holidays.description: Experience the normal rhythm of the academic city, with students attending classes and frequenting cafes.

unique_experiences.activity: Explore the University of Coimbra (Alta & Sofia)
unique_experiences.description: Visit the historic University complex including the Biblioteca Joanina, Royal Palace, Chapel, and Science Museum with relatively fewer crowds.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book Library slot online. Wear comfortable shoes. Check opening hours.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit Machado de Castro National Museum
unique_experiences.description: Explore one of Portugal's most important museums, built over a Roman cryptoporticus. Excellent indoor option for cooler or wetter days.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow several hours. Check opening times.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the main commercial streets, discover traditional shops, visit the Santa Cruz Church/Monastery, and enjoy coffee at Café Santa Cruz.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Relatively flat area. Good for experiencing daily city life.

unique_experiences.description: See the early signs of spring as the historic Botanical Garden begins to awaken. Enjoy the peaceful paths and glasshouses.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry to most areas. Wear comfortable shoes. Might be damp underfoot after rain.

weather.precipitation: Rain becomes less frequent, sunny days more common. Feels more consistently like spring.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering, but might need lighter options more often. Sunscreen advised for clear days. Umbrella still worth carrying.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate, noticeably increasing towards April, especially if Easter falls late March.
tourism_level.pricing: Still shoulder season, but book ahead if traveling during Easter week as prices surge.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Pleasant spring awakening. City feels lively. Busy and festive if Easter occurs.

events_holidays.name: Easter Week (Semana Santa) Celebrations (if applicable)
events_holidays.description: If Easter falls in this period, look for religious processions (like the Ecce Homo procession), special services in the Cathedrals (Sé Velha, Sé Nova), and traditional Easter foods.
events_holidays.notes: Coimbra has significant Holy Week traditions. Expect crowds and higher prices if Easter occurs.

events_holidays.name: St. Patrick's Day (Observed minimally)
events_holidays.description: Very minor observance, perhaps some promotions in Irish-themed pubs, if any exist and are open.

unique_experiences.description: Explore one of Portugal's largest and best-preserved Roman settlements, including impressive mosaics and foundations, as the weather becomes more suitable for outdoor sites.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Accessible by bus or car. Allow half a day. Wear comfortable walking shoes.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a walk or relax in the riverside park as spring arrives. Cross the Pedro e Inês footbridge for city views.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Pleasant on sunny days. Cafes offer outdoor seating.

unique_experiences.where: Santa Clara side, across the river
unique_experiences.description: Visit the romantic gardens linked to Pedro and Inês, enjoying the emerging spring blooms and historical setting.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Small entrance fee. Wear comfortable shoes.

unique_experiences.where: Venues like 'aCapella' or Fado ao Centro
unique_experiences.description: Experience the unique Coimbra Fado in an intimate setting as evenings remain cool.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check schedules and book ahead if possible, especially weekends.
